name: Easy Garlic Parmesan Popovers
description: Amazingly light, airy and moist popovers made so easily with one bowl. No mixer needed here!

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Place a popover pan into the oven.*
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Place a popover pan into the oven.*

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, whisk together milk and eggs until frothy, about 1 minute. Whisk in flour, chives, garlic powder, salt, basil and pepper until just incorporated.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, whisk together milk and eggs until frothy, about 1 minute. Whisk in flour, chives, garlic powder, salt, basil and pepper until just incorporated.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove popover pan from the oven and generously grease with bacon fat. Working quickly, fill popover pan half full with egg mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove popover pan from the oven and generously grease with bacon fat. Working quickly, fill popover pan half full with egg mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Place into oven and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Place into oven and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately with butter and Parmesan.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately with butter and Parmesan.

review.reviewBody: I increased the recipe 2 cups milk and flour and 4 eggs (by a third, etc). Used butter since we did not have the bacon grease. Then halfed the salt. I had only dries chives, so subbed a teaspoon or 2 of that. Incorporated the parmesan cheese into the batter. I make popovers regularly and was away from my cookbook so went online for a recipe with garlic in it. These came out better than my usual ones (parmesan basil). They did stick a little. Probably should check tips on greasing the pan. Working with a hot muffin tins worked well. Had not tried that before, but I use a preheated pan for biscuits to help them rise better. This will now be my go to recipe. Thank you.
